snippet: The success of the British drama “Downton Abbey” prompted the organization to change its programming and marketing tactics, and aim at viewers more attuned to HBO and Showtime.
abstract: Public Broadcasting Service, in effort to freshen its image and lift revenue, is aiming at viewers more attuned to pay channels like HBO and Showtime; success of British drama Downton Abbey is prompting PBS to spruce up its prime-time lineup.
lead_paragraph: The success of the British drama “Downton Abbey” prompted the organization to change its programming and marketing tactics, and aim at viewers more attuned to HBO and Showtime.

headline.seo: PBS Shifts Tactics to Reach Wider Audience
headline.main: PBS Takes On the Premium Channels
headline.print_headline: PBS Takes On the Premium Channels
